module:
development.folder="dvlp">
module, mapping, relationship, cardinality
This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to specify the cardinalities for a mapping between classes.
The mapping 'motor cycle wheel' between:
the class of product 'motor cycle'; and
the class of product 'wheel',
that indicates motor cycles have wheels, is a class_of_composition_of_product.
The cardinality for this mapping is follows:
a motor cycle is the whole for two or three wheels;
a wheel is part of zero or one motor cycle.
The mapping 'motor car front off-side wheel' between:
the class of product 'motor car'; and
the class of product 'wheel',
that indicates motor cars have front off-side wheels, is a class_of_composition_of_product.
The cardinality for this mapping is follows:
a motor car is the whole for one front off-side wheel;
a wheel is part of zero or one motor car.
The mapping 'motor car front off-side wheel' between:
the class of product 'motor car'; and
the class of product 'front off-side wheel',
that indicates motor cars have front off-side wheels, is a class_of_composition_of_product.
The cardinality for this mapping is follows:
a motor car is the whole for one front off-side wheel;
a front off-side wheel is part of one motor car.
the cardinalities for a mapping or relationship between classes
the definition of a mapping or relationship.
The Cardinality_of_relationship UoF specifies the cardinality of a mapping between two classes.
cardinality_of_related_class 1211
maths_space_context.abstract_space 51 cardinality_of_related_class<= maths_space_context
maths_space_context.physical_space 51 cardinality_of_related_class<= maths_space_context
cardinality_of_relating_class 1211
maths_space_context.abstract_space 51 cardinality_of_relating_class<= maths_space_context
maths_space_context.physical_space 51 cardinality_of_relating_class<= maths_space_context
